N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 590.3 - General authorization and prohibitions

State Regulations
(a) Except as otherwise provided in this

Part, a chief administrative officer may grant authorization for the possession
of firearms, rifles, airguns or shotguns only if such possession is required or
permitted for specifically authorized: (1)
educational programs; (2)
scientific research; (3)
skeet, trap, or other target shooting activities carrier on under the supervision of
the university; or
(4)
for the
storage of sporting arms. (b) Except as otherwise provided in this

Part, any such authorization granted pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
section may be rescinded at any time but in no event shall be valid for longer
than one academic year, and shall be nontransferable. (c) No firearm, rifle, shotgun, airgun or
other weapon may be used, loaded, fired or discharged unless under the
supervision of a qualified firearms instructor approved by the university. This
prohibition shall not apply to forestry lands under the control of the State

University College of Environmental Science and Forestry or farm lands under
the control of the State University College of Technology at Alfred. Notes
